bare.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: a ragged child with bare feet
She felt the warm sun on her bare arms.
bare.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: not covered by trees or grass, or not having any leaves
bare.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The trees soon gave way to bare rock.
bare.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: empty, not covered by anything, or not having any decorations
bare.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: She looked round her tiny bare room.
bare.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the very least amount of something that you need to do something
bare.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The room had the bare minimum (=the smallest amount possible) of furniture.
If you ask her about herself, she gives only the barest (=the smallest amount possible) of details.
Her bag was light, packed with only the bare essentials.
bare.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to remove something that was covering or hiding something
bare.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: He bared his back to the hot sun.
bare.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: very, or a lot of – used by young people
bare.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Check out this new game – it’s bare hard.
bare.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: if a business goes bare, it decides not to buy insurance to protect it against claims for damage or harm done by its products
bare.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Some firms choose to go bare, preferring possible bankruptcy to the certainty of huge insurance premiums.
